DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Non-Reason Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of applying, introducing or otherwise giving medications or other substances to the subject or experimental unit. EXAMPLE(S): (1) An experimental unit receives methotrexate as part of chemotherapy, radiation therapy. (2) For a substance administration, target anatomic site code = coronary artery, approach anatomic site code = groin, route of administration code = intra-arterial. A coded value specifying the motivation, cause or rationale that is explicitly NOT why an activity occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Non-Reason Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A coded value specifying the motivation, cause or rationale that is explicitly NOT why an activity occurred.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the motivation, cause or rationale that is explicitly NOT why an activity occurred.

Concepts.definition: A coded value specifying that an expected reason for something occurring was not the motivation, cause or rationale in this particular case.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection containing unordered distinct/discrete values of the type CD.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
